==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Etymology===
Literally: like what?

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=rúhé
|c=jyu4 ho4
|h=pfs=yì-hò
|mn=qz:lû-hô͘/tp,xm:lû-hô/kh,zz:jû-hô/twvk:jî-hô
|mn_note=lî-hô - unknown dialect
|ma=y
|cat=adv
}}

===Adverb===
{{zh-adv}} {{tcx|formal|lang=zh}}

# [[how]]
#: {{zh-x|她 教{jiāo} 我 如何 游泳。|She taught me '''how''' to swim.}}
#: {{zh-x|你 現在 感覺 如何？|'''How''' do you feel now?}}
#: {{zh-x|你 覺得{de} 這 個 計劃 如何？|What do you think of this plan?}}
# [[how]] [[about]] ...? {{gloss|used to make a suggestion}}
#: {{zh-x|下 週六 '''如何'''？|'''How about''' next Saturday?}}

====Synonyms====
{{zh-dial|怎樣}}

====Derived terms====
{{zh-der|無論如何|如何是好|無可如何}}

{{zh-cat|Elementary}}

==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=どう}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=どう}}. Possibly from older form {{m|ja|だう|tr=dau}}, much like the shift from {{m|ja|かう|tr=kau}} → {{m|ja|こう|tr=kō||like this, this way}}, or {{m|ja|さう|tr=sau}} → {{m|ja|そう|tr=sō||like that, that way}}.

The kanji spelling is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]], using the corresponding Chinese term for the spelling and the underlying Japanese root word for the reading.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|どう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Adverb====
{{ja-pos|adverb|どう}}

# in [[what]] manner, [[how]]
# [[what about]]... (used to make a suggestion)

=====Usage notes=====
The term ''dō'' is generally considered more prosaic and informal than the synonym {{ja-r|いかが}}.

More commonly spelled in hiragana as {{ja-l|どう}}. The kanji spelling is rare.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=いか}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=いか}}. Appears to be a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いか|い|tr1=i|pos1=uncertain element, might be the い prefix found in {{etyl|ojp|-}} as an intensifier|か|tr2=ka|pos2=the question marker particle}}.

The kanji spelling is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]], using the corresponding Chinese term for the spelling and the underlying Japanese root word for the reading.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|いか}}

====Adjective====
{{ja-adj|infl=na|いか}}

# [[what]] [[kind]] of

=====Usage notes=====
Some dictionaries<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> class this as a bound morpheme. In practice, it generally conjugates and behaves as a regular ''-na'' adjective. In formal writing, this is more commonly encountered using the classical attributive form {{m|ja|如何}}{{m|ja|なる|tr=ikanaru}}.

====Inflection====
{{ja-na|いか}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=いかが}}
{{IPAchar|/ika ni ka/}} → *{{IPAchar|/ikanka/}} → {{IPAchar|/ikanga/}} → {{IPAchar|/ikaga/}}

Originally a phrase consisting of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いかが|如何|tr1=ika|t1=what kind|に|tr2=ni|pos2=adverbial particle|か|tr3=ka|pos3=question marker particle}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|いかが|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Adverb====
{{ja-pos|adverb|いかが}}

# in [[what]] manner, [[how]]
# [[what about]]... (used to make a suggestion)

=====Usage notes=====
The term ''ikaga'' is generally considered more formal and polite than the synonym {{ja-r|どう}}.

More commonly spelled in hiragana as {{ja-l|いかが}}. The kanji spelling is rare.

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=いかん}}
{{IPAchar|/ika ni/}} → {{IPAchar|/ikan/}}

Originally a phrase consisting of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いかん|如何|tr1=ika|t1=what kind|に|tr2=ni|pos2=adverbial particle}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> the normal adverbial form of adjective ''ika'' above.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|いかん|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いかん}}

# the [[whatever]]s, the [[why]]s and [[wherefore]]s
#: {{ja-usex|理由の'''如何'''を問わず|りゆう の '''いかん''' を とわず|without getting into the '''whys and wherefores''' of the reasons}}

====Adverb====
{{ja-pos|adverb|いかん}}

# [[howsoever]], [[however]] [it may be]

=====Usage notes=====
Generally used at the end of a sentence to express doubt.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|如何が|いかんが}}: in [[what]] manner, [[how]] {{qualifier|superseded by modern</i> ikaga<i>; see above}}
* {{ja-r|如何せん|いかんせん}}: [[no matter what]] {{qualifier|in a negative connotation}}, [[unfortunately]]
* {{ja-r|如何ぞ|いかんぞ}}: [[howsoever]], [[however]] [it may be] {{qualifier|more intense than ''ikan'' on its own}}
* {{ja-r|如何とも}}|いかんとも: [[no matter what]] {{qualifier|in a negative connotation}}, [[unfortunately]]
{{der-bottom}}
